trans-unit.source: Represents changes in pitch for the speech content of a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.
The pitch contour is defined as an array of targets at specified time positions in the speech output.
Each target is defined by three parameters.
The first value is a percentage of the period of the contained text (a number followed by "%").
The second value specifies the amount to raise or lower the pitch.
The third value designates the unit to use for the number specified in the second value; either percentage or hertz (Hz).

<xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint> objects are obtained by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody.GetContourPoints%2A> method, or used to set the pitch contour for a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment> by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.Prosody.SetContourPoints%2A> method.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Single"></xref> that specifies the point at which to apply the pitch change in the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.
This is expressed as the elapsed percentage of the duration of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> at that point.
A <xref href="System.Single"></xref> that specifies the amount to raise or lower the pitch.
A member of that specifies the unit to use for the number specified in the change parameter.
Gets the value that represents the amount to raise or lower the pitch at a point in a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.
This value is combined with a value from the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint.ChangeType%2A> property to define the amount to raise or lower the pitch.
If a pitch value is not defined for 0% or 100% then the nearest pitch target is copied.
All relative values for the pitch are relative to the pitch value just before the contained text.
Gets a member of that specifies the unit to use for the number specified in the change parameter of a object.
A value from this enumeration is combined with a value from the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint.Change%2A> property to define the amount to raise or lower the pitch.

Determines if a given object is an instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref> and equal to the current instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref>.
The method returns false if the <xref:System.Object> provided by the `obj` argument cannot be cast to <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint>.
An object that can be cast to an instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref>.
Returns `true` if the current instance of and that obtained from the obj argument are equal, otherwise returns `false`.

Determines if a given instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref> is equal to the current instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref> that will be compared to the current instance.
Returns `true` if both the current instance of and that supplied through the other argument are equal, otherwise returns `false`.
Returns a hash code for this instance.
Two <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint> objects might have the same hash code even though they represent different time values.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Determines if two instances of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref> are equal.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint.Equals%28System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint%2CSystem.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An instance of to compare against the instance of provided by the point2 argument.
An instance of to compare against the instance of provided by the point1 argument.
Returns `true` if the instances referenced by point1 and point2 are equal, otherwise returns `false`.
Determines if two instances of <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint"></xref> are NOT equal.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint.Compare%28System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint%2CSystem.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.ContourPoint%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An instance of to compare against the instance of provided by the point2 argument.
An instance of to compare against the instance of provided by the point1 argument.
Returns `true` if the instances referenced by point1 and point2 are NOT equal, otherwise returns `false`.
Gets a <xref href="System.Single"></xref> that specifies the point at which to apply the pitch change in a <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref>.
This is expressed as the elapsed percentage of the duration of the <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.TtsEngine.TextFragment"></xref> at that point.
Time position values less than 0% or greater than 100% are ignored.
